Q: Can you send me a list of all our members? A: Extract member list -- link freshdeskartikel når den er skabt Q: I need access to the portal A: Access to portal , link freshdesk artikel når den er skabt
description:
Access to portalFrequently Asked Questions 

  

Q: Can I print a list of all customers transactions? 

A: You can't, but you can see all the receipts in the database. 

  

Q: Can you send me a list of all our members? 

A: Extract member list -- link freshdeskartikel når den er skabt

  

Q: I need access to the portal 

A: Access to portal , link freshdesk artikel når den er skabt

title: Access to Loyalty portal
text: How to give access to Loyalty for DdD Employees and Customers Following below steps will grant the user access to the following 2 portals Admin portal: https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/ - CUSTOMERS SHOULD NOT RECEIVE THIS LINK This is where you extract full member lists for the entire club Link to customer portal: https://portal.dddretail.com/#/login This is where you look up specific loyalty club member info Step 1: Open https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/ Step 2: Go to Support by clicking on the Support tab Step 3: Go to User Management Step 4: From the drop-down in the upper-left side called "Select Chain"; Find DdDEmployees (Or the store name if a customer) Step 5: Press the "New User" icon on the upper right side. Step 6: Add the new user Step 7: Press save in the bottom of the screen There is no synchronisation time, so the access should work immediately.
description:
How to give access to Loyalty for DdD Employees and Customers 

  

  

Following below steps will grant the user access to the following 2 portals 

  

  • Admin portal: https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/   - CUSTOMERS SHOULD NOT RECEIVE THIS LINK 

  • This is where you extract full member lists for the entire club 

  

  • Link to customer portal: https://portal.dddretail.com/#/login 

  • This is where you look up specific loyalty club member info 

  

  

  

Step 1: Open https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/ 

Step 2: Go to Support by clicking on the Support tab 



Step 3: Go to User Management 


Step 4: From the drop-down in the upper-left side called "Select Chain"; Find DdDEmployees (Or the store name if a customer) 


Step 5: Press the "New User" icon on the upper right side. 


Step 6: Add the new user 


Step 7: Press save in the bottom of the screen
  

 

There is no synchronisation time, so the access should work immediately.

title: Add loyalty club
text: Be ware that you can provide access to any Loyalty club Add store to your Loyalty user
description:
Be ware that you can provide access to any Loyalty club  

  

Add store to your Loyalty user

title: Create new user
text: To setup a new user (e.g. for one of us), someone with an account needs to log into the protal: https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login Click Support Click User Management Select chain = DdDEmployees Click New User, then Toggle Modules Fill in the user details (you may have to scroll to the bottom to get to this window) Username, user e-mail, First Name, Last Name, add a password and confirm it, Language Then click Toggle Modules Tick the four standard modules (you can always add more later) Click Save When adding a new user to a customer, check with one of the other users which modules they have access to and activate those.
description:
To setup a new user (e.g. for one of us), someone with an account needs to log into the protal: 

  

https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login 

Click Support  

Click User Management 

Select chain = DdDEmployees

  

Click New User, then Toggle Modules

Fill in the user details (you may have to scroll to the bottom to get to this window) 

  

Username, user e-mail, First Name, Last Name, add a password and confirm it, Language 

  

Then click Toggle Modules 

Tick the four standard modules (you can always add more later) 

  

Click Save 

When adding a new user to a customer, check with one of the other users which modules they have access to and activate those.

title: Extract member list
text: Customer calls in asking for a list of all their customers If you do not have access, please refer to: Access Step 1: Go to Portal: https://loyalty2dev.dddretail.com/#/ Step 2: Click on the store you are extracting the list for Step 3: Click on "Extract members" Step 4: Open the Excel file that it downloads
description:
Customer calls in asking for a list of all their customers 

  

  

If you do not have access, please refer to: Access    

  

Step 1: Go to Portal: https://loyalty2dev.dddretail.com/#/ 

  

Step 2: Click on the store you are extracting the list for 

  

Step 3: Click on "Extract members" 

Step 4: Open the Excel file that it downloads

title: Urls
text: DdD Loyalty is the database for our customers to track the members of their stores. Admin portal: https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/ (NOT FOR CUSTOMERS!!!!) Customer portal: https://portal.dddretail.com/#/login
description:
DdD Loyalty is the database for our customers to track the members of their stores.  

  

Admin portal: https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/ (NOT FOR CUSTOMERS!!!!) 

  

Customer portal: https://portal.dddretail.com/#/login

title: List of Loyalty Members from a customer
text: If a customer asks for a list of their loyalty members, you must first add the shop to your account. Open https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login and login. Click support Click User Management Find DdDEmployees Search for your name (username) Click on your account Click Toggle Modules If Loyalty is not yet selected, select it first, then expand the dropdown list. Search for the company either by name or by Club ID and select it, then click save. Click Save Click the three dots and then Go To Portal Scroll down and click on the customer Click Export Members Open Excel and open the csv file (Member.csv). Click Next Untick Tab and tick Comma, then click next Click Finish Click Do Not Convert to avoid Excel removing leading zeros. Save the Excel document under an appropriate name (remember to change the format to Excel Workbook) and send to customer.
description:
If a customer asks for a list of their loyalty members, you must first add the shop to your account.

 

Open https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login and login.

Click support

Click User Management

Find DdDEmployees

Search for your name (username)

Click on your account

Click Toggle Modules

If Loyalty is not yet selected, select it first, then expand the dropdown list.

Search for the company either by name or by Club ID and select it, then click save.

Click Save

Click the three dots and then Go To Portal

Scroll down and click on the customer

 

Click Export Members

Open Excel and open the csv file (Member.csv).

Click Next

Untick Tab and tick Comma, then click next

Click Finish

Click Do Not Convert to avoid Excel removing leading zeros.

Save the Excel document under an appropriate name (remember to change the format to Excel Workbook) and send to customer.

title: Loyalty Engines
text: The DiscountLevelEngine awards customers with bonuses constantly with each purchase. The bonus percentage is determined based on the current DiscountLevel. Each level defines a discount percentage, which is applied while the customer is in this level. When the customer collects more points and reaches a new level, the percentage for all following purchases changes. Customers may also drop down to a lower level. The points expire after a given number of days, which may drop the customer back to a lower discount level. In the BonusLevelEngine bonuses are applied only when the customer reaches a new bonus level. Levels are reached by collecting a given amount of points. By varying the bonus level rules it is possible to increase or decrease the time (number of points) between two levels. It is also possible to define the bonus amount for reaching a level. Bonus points also expire after a given amount of days and it is also possible to define how long it takes until a bonus level can be regained. This is important to avoid fraud doing small purchases on a regular basis, hopping up and down from one level to the next again and again. This StaticDiscountEnginesimply defines a static discount, which is applied on the POS at the time of the purchase. No further data, apart from the static discounts per user, is stored in the database.
description:
The DiscountLevelEngine awards customers with bonuses constantly with each purchase. The bonus percentage is determined based on the current DiscountLevel. Each level defines a discount percentage, which is applied while the customer is in this level. When the customer collects more points and reaches a new level, the percentage for all following purchases changes.

Customers may also drop down to a lower level. The points expire after a given number of days, which may drop the customer back to a lower discount level.

 

In the BonusLevelEngine bonuses are applied only when the customer reaches a new bonus level. Levels are reached by collecting a given amount of points.

By varying the bonus level rules it is possible to increase or decrease the time (number of points) between two levels. It is also possible to define the bonus amount for reaching a level.

Bonus points also expire after a given amount of days and it is also possible to define how long it takes until a bonus level can be regained. This is important to avoid fraud doing small purchases on a regular basis, hopping up and down from one level to the next again and again.

 

This StaticDiscountEnginesimply defines a static discount, which is applied on the POS at the time of the purchase. No further data, apart from the static discounts per user, is stored in the database.

title: Add a store to your login
text: In order to edit a client's loyalty club members, you first need to add the client to your login. Log in with your credentials on https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login If you do not have any credentials, ask a colleague who has to set you up. Click on Support Click User Management 1. Find DdDEmployee 2. Type in your username 3. Click Search 4. Tick your username 5. Click Toggle Modules Click on the down arrow to the right of loyalty Find the client name (search) and tick the circle in front of the name Click Save Click on the three dots in the upper righthand corner Click Go to portal The client will now be visible at the bottom of the screen.
description:
In order to edit a client's loyalty club members, you first need to add the client to your login.


Log in with your credentials on https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login


If you do not have any credentials, ask a colleague who has to set you up.


Click on Support


 

Click User Management

 


1. Find DdDEmployee


2. Type in your username


3. Click Search


4. Tick your username


5. Click Toggle Modules



Click on the down arrow to the right of loyalty



Find the client name (search) and tick the circle in front of the name


Click Save



Click on the three dots in the upper righthand corner


Click Go to portal



The client will now be visible at the bottom of the screen.

title: Add points manually to a customer's account
text: If there has been an issue with adding points to a customer's loyalty account, this can be done manually. In order to edit a client's loyalty club members, you first need to add the client to your login. Log in with your credentials on https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login If you do not have any credentials, ask a colleague who has, to set you up. If you do not have the client listed when you log in, you first need to add them to your account. Please follow this guide: https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000284370-add-a-store-to-your-login Click on the store name Type in name or phone number for the customer and click Search Click on the customer name To the right, you can see how many points the customer has available. To add points, enter them under Manual Points Click Save Changes
description:
If there has been an issue with adding points to a customer's loyalty account, this can be done manually.


In order to edit a client's loyalty club members, you first need to add the client to your login.


Log in with your credentials on https://portaldev.dddretail.com/#/login


If you do not have any credentials, ask a colleague who has, to set you up.


If you do not have the client listed when you log in, you first need to add them to your account. Please follow this guide: https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000284370-add-a-store-to-your-login


Click on the store name



Type in name or phone number for the customer and click Search



Click on the customer name


To the right, you can see how many points the customer has available.


To add points, enter them under Manual Points


Click  Save Changes
